data.title: Very LOUD music!!!!!!!!
data.text: My little family met a couple from out-of-town last night (Friday). We selected this place because it was well rated on TripAdvisor and the location is sort-of in between us all.  Well what a surprise about 5 minutes after we arrived a "musician" started playing several electronic instruments VERY, VERY LOUDLY. I can't describe just how loud it was.  Nobody could hear any other person speak while this guy was doing his thing.  We packed up and left immediately.  Don't go her if you want conversation or quiet!!!

data.title: Great pre-concert meal!
data.text: We came early before a concert at Verizon and, despite the very industrial neighborhood, this restaurant is a wonderful find! Fresh seafood, great drinks, reasonable prices and fantastic and friendly service!

data.title: Great Seafood.
data.text: The best seafood cocktail in the metroplex. Great seafood all around. Fried or grilled it's all good. Try the fish soup!!!

data.title: Amazing food, great prices
data.text:
This is one of the best restaurants I have been to. The food was amazing and prices great.
We had a red snapper done in foil with a cheese and chilli sauce which was to die for and jambalaya which was fantastic.
Nothing fancy in the decor, but the good better than most exclusive seafood restaurants I've been to around the world.

data.title: If you like Mexican food and seafood, this is the place!
data.text:
I get so tired of the standard enchiladas/tacos/beans/rice places. Ugh!

This place is near the Verizon Theater and has authentic ceviche, lots of fresh dishes, authentic cuisine, and virtually every dish utilizes fresh seafood in a unique presentation.

Very, very good and if it wasn't so far from Mesquite, we'd go more!

Check it out!

data.title: Good Hot Sauce, Great Ceviche, Cold Beer
data.text:
I was looking for a place to meet my wife for a happy hour snack and avoid Dallas traffic, and this was one of the few Mexican places in the area with good reviews and with a full bar.  This restaurant has an interesting layout.  It's like a cross between a diner and a no-frills Mexican place (tame décor).  Strangely enough, they've chosen to place tables under most of the bar.  It's definitely an odd arrangement, but the bar is very long and likely too big for their clientele.
  
The complementary chips and hot sauce were good—not great but certainly passable.  We split a ceviche tostada that was absolutely loaded with...well, ceviche.  Normally, I'm not a fan of the dish, but it was actually the best I've ever tried.  However, my wife is generally a big fan of ceviche and didn't much care for their version.  Beer was cold and cheap, and the staff was pleasant.  I'd go back if I'm in the area again and looking to kill some time.
